Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlderEd
Reviews.Content: This is a nice boutique hotel with clean rooms and virtually no noise. Small breakfast is provided. Free parking in basement, but space is small. Convenient to a variety of restaurants. Good value for "in-town LA" hotel next to UCLA. Help was very friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “westwood secret”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A
Reviews.Content: We are often visiting Westwood to see our student at UCLA. The Hilgard House is a lovely alternative to staying across the street at the W Hotel. It is small, quiet, clean and a good value. The gentlemen that run it are very nice and helpful. There are coffee, tea and pastries in the lobby in the morning and no charge to have a car in the garage. Lovely place!

Reviews.Title: “The quietest hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Millcaro
Reviews.Content: What a delight my stay here was. I'm a crazy light sleeper and the Hilgard House gave me a perfect night's sleep. My room had a white noise machine and the big bay window gave onto the side of the building, rather than the somewhat busy Hilgard Avenue. The hotel is small enough (roughly 10 rooms per floor?) that people aren't coming and going very often. I never heard people staying in rooms on either side of, or below, me. Lots of other perks to recommend the Hilgard House: * Front desk staff were helpful, knowledegable, and kind, but inobtrusive. * Free wireless is a nice bonus - at other hotels, I feel gouged paying for this product when they could share it with their patrons so easily; not so at Hilgard House. * Parking is secure and easy. * Westwood is walkable - I found a Ralph's nearby handy; great pizza down the street; the bar at the W across the street has a cheap happy hour. The other patrons who remark on the low shower heads are right - this feature is an odd one. But the tubs are nice and big - I took a nice bath, instead :)

Reviews.Title: “Great charm, location and value. Shame about shower and wifi”
Reviews.Author: MaldivesComplete
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy staying at the Hilgard. The rooms have a delightful charm and comfort. The morning breakfast buffet is handy and good quality. The location is great. The price is right. Unfortunately, two major problems. The water pressure on the showers is weaker than a lizard with a bladder infection. And for some reason, the wireless Internet just crawls to a halt in the evenings making Internet totally unmanageable.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mohabian
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m giving only 4 stars because itâ€™s not a five star experience, but I would definitely stay here again and have no real complaints about the hotel. The location is terrific and the staff friendly. Itâ€™s in a quiet, mainly residential area a couple of blocks from UCLA. The botanical garden is only a block away. Across the street from the hotel is fabulous and expensive W Hotel. Within a short walking distance, there are restaurants, shops, and movies. ALSO free parking! Thatâ€™s a rare thing in L.A. The Hilgard House is a older hotel. It seems to me that it may have been built in the 1940 or possibly a bit earlier. I read a review saying it was similar to some old, small European hotel, and I agree with that assessment. There is a lot of dark wood veneer that is a bit shabby. The rooms have been updated but they are not completely modern. This is both good and bad. The room I was in had a window seat and a view onto the grounds of the church next door. The view was green and very pretty. However, the outside of the windows were dusty and that spoiled the view a little. The room decor could use some updating with a new bedspread and furniture. However, the bed was comfortable, and the pillows were too â€” not too soft and not too hard. The TV looked great. Itâ€™s a wall mounted flat screen. I didnâ€™t watch it, but it looked as if it would be nice. The bathroom is small and has a low shower head. Iâ€™m 5â€™7â€� and it was low for me. The tub appeared to be new and it was a spacious oval shape. There are double sinks so someone could be outside the bathroom and still be getting ready. There was also a refrigerator in the foyer area of the room. So, to sum it up, the hotel is not â€œluxe,â€� but it is in and near a â€œluxeâ€� and â€œdeluxeâ€� area of L.A. Everything is very convenient. I was visiting the Getty Museum, and it was an easy 10 or 15 minute drive away. I do need to add that I visited during a university holiday, so the area may be busier with traffic when school is in session. As it was, I could sleep with the window open and not be disturbed by the noise. Thatâ€™s a rare thing for me in a city like Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Thanksgiving weekend here because he got tired of sleeping on a futon at my parents' house every year. The staff is incredibly friendly, there is free parking (a major deal in Westwood where all street parking is time limited or restricted. The continental breakfast is bagels and fruit and drinks. Cursory, but adequate; you take it up to your room or out with you wherever you're headed (no dining area). The rooms are good size, the bed quite comfy, with free wifi and 41" t.v. with premium channels if you care. Some noise from the neighbor's water pipes around midnight, but I was up on my computer, otherwise wouldn't have heard it. My husband slept right through it. Very reasonably priced for the location and the value. Will stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for UCLA patients”
Reviews.Author: lih
Reviews.Content: This quaint European-style hotel offers the best bang for your buck. Each morning they offer a wide variety of contential breakfast items including hot & cold cereal, muffins and toast. The rooms are equiped with a fridge and microwave. Although the furniture may be dated the linens are fresh and clean. The staff is especially helpful and accomodating. It is only a few blocks walking distance to UCLA Medical Center. Why stay just across the street for hundreds more?

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Clean, Authentic and convenient”
Reviews.Author: DrRoy52
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights (the first days of chilling rain coincidentally) at the Hilgard House. I liked the vibe immediately. Clean rooms, heavily laden with wooden treatments and lineoleum floors, an overhead fan, and an air purifier (or something akin) along with a soft and comfy bed made this a nice spot for meetings at UCLA and convenient to travel. Ample parking and good buffet continental breakfast including bagels, juice, cereal, fruit and tempting Krispy Kreme donuts. My only complaints: the plastic plates for breakfast were flimsy (no place to sit so all of it was to go) and the shower (with wonderfully hot water) head was placed so low had I had to squat (am 6 ft 2) for the full head effect. Nice, friendly staff and great eating within a few blocks (Sushi, Korean, etc). I would stay again in a heartbeat since it is cool and doesnt have a chain feel (because its not). Now if they added a happy hour with wine it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “nostalgic and quiet”
Reviews.Author: jessica198
Reviews.Content: I traveled about 14 hours from Singapore to LA. I stayed in Hilgard house for 4 weeks during my visits to UCLA. Hilgard has its own charm that I liked. Majority of the staff members were warm and friendly. I particularly liked the free flow of hot drinks throughout the day. The breakfast was simple and good though not elaborative. In terms of accessibility, needless to say, was excellent. It is very near Ralph (opens 24 hrs) and many eateries and best of all a stone-throw from the medical center where I was visiting. The room condition is clean and acceptable -depends how you make it to be. Though I was referred to an alternative hotel, I chosed to remain in Hilgard house because I find serenity and safe in the environment. I will definitely stay in Hilgard again should I return one day. Thanks to the hotel crews who have made my stay a pleasant and memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a great place... COULD.”
Reviews.Author: cortney k
Reviews.Content: It was unfortunate that our 5 year old was scheduled for brain surgery the week students moved back to UCLA because everything was booked. The location is great... right behind the Tiverton which is where we usually stay. Appearance wise it seemed as though we were in for a treat because we love nostalgia. Once in the room, we were really disappointed because the floors had not been "cleaned" ...There were dried old spills and spot marks all over the entry and bathroom floors. The bathroom smelled like a urinal and it seemed "wiped" down. There was a small fridge which was not keeping our child's medicine cold and when we opened the door, the floor around the fridge was filthy. It was as if the fridge had been further away from the wall and was never cleaned underneath... then was pushed back to the wall to reveal old spills and poor mopping. Very gross. We had to be moved to the only available room which was a suite at $199 a night. At first glance again it seemed okay. The sofas were badly stained and the carpet filthy around it. Everything needed to cleaned. The counters and dining table left the wash cloth so dirty we couldn't wash it out with soap. We took a photo of it, because it bothered us so much we wanted to tell the manager. We didn't so much care that the patio was uninviting because we were more concerned with caring for our five year old. I found the accommodations inexcusably uncomfortably dirty. A little dust we can deal with... dirty, no. Just an irritant was the WiFi was continually out and needed resetting. This place could be great if it was better kept. The walls have hand prints and the whole place needs a good cleaning and makeover. I don't know about the other rooms but when you can't walk around without shoes on because your feet get black, that is just wrong. Gross. I give it 2 stars just because it had a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give this a Five star rating sans the breakfest is very little to be desired, overall great stay”
Reviews.Author: textiletyke
Reviews.Content: Try and book directly with hotel for they offer specials on certain dates

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel in a great area.”
Reviews.Author: Marchender
Reviews.Content: Free parking, a more or less edible breakfast, good sized room and pleasant ambience - quite a pleasing stay of 2 nights. We used it as a base for the Getty and we enjoyed the local area around the hotel. We will certainly stay here again when we are next in LA.

Reviews.Title: “A very decent UCLA-proximate value”
Reviews.Author: IDOUCAN
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the large, comfortable and quiet rooms. Parking is included in the rate. Walking distance from most of UCLA buildings. A very decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred it over the W”
Reviews.Author: Mikeysgirl1129
Reviews.Content: The night before I stayed here I was at the W. It was such an overall disappointed when you factor in the nightly rate, that I checked out and walked across the street to this hotel. I was so pleasantly surprised. It was 1/3 the rate, my WIRELESS internet was free and all the coffee and tea I can drink. The rooms were quiet and clean and equipped with a fridge. I had a great stay and will stay here again when I come back on business. The area is nice. UCLA is right here. There are restaurants and a 24hr grocery store. Couldn't be happier. I definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel, Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: familySeattleWa
Reviews.Content: WE had a wonderful 3 night stay in HIlgard House. You are steps from the UCLA campus, and around the corner from all that Westwood has to offer. The prices are VERY reasonable, and the best part is the SERVICE. The management really cares about their hotel, and wants to make your experience good. I changed my reservation 3 times (circumstances beyond my control) and the front desk staff couldn't have been kinder. I left some clothes in a drawer, and was contacted promptly so I could retrieve them before I left town. It is the little touches, like power plugs on the lights by the beds, nice big bathroom counters, soaking tubs, refrigerators, safes and a very adequate FREE breakfast (fruit, cereal, bagels, donuts, juice, coffee) from 7 to 10. If you are expecting luxury, this is not your place. If you want a comfortable room, well priced and located, with parking, friendly staff, in a great area, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The doors make a thunderous noise when closed-can't they quiet them?”
Reviews.Author: kjlopp
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very nice place to stay. However, I would have liked to have not heard the doors of the other rooms slamming shut. The management should put padding on the doors, so that when they automatically close, they won't wake up everyone on the floor. It's an outrage, especially when you're paying over $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in expensive Westwood neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: rehovot79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference at UCLA. Its good value for being close to the University and to shops and restaurants on Westwood. The rooms are large, functional (plenty of electricity outlets) and decorated old style. Free wifi. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast is bagels/muffins/cereal ,coffee, milk, nothing fancy and you have to eat it in the small lobby or take it to your room.

Reviews.Title: “small but comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharona07
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed when I arrived this hotel. It appears old and small from outside and totally different from the photos onlline. The rooms are small but with good quality furnitures. The room I stayed has a small patio which was very nice. The staff was great and can't complain about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in my first 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Azdaizy
Reviews.Content: I was horrified to find a water cap within sheets & hair on pillows. Sheets had NOT been changed. Called ft desk after maid changed them. Never heard bk frm Mgr. Yet to hear response to email sent 5 days ago. How can I recommend a place that doesn't take pride in their establishment &treatment of guests?

Reviews.Title: “Good rates, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: missjaynel
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable, if a little old, and well priced and the laundry access was a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, elegant, charming”
Reviews.Author: teony20
Reviews.Content: Excellent, central location for Los Angeles touring. Nice to walk around Westwood Village. Nice, quiet hotel. The continental breakfast is simple, but nice. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: suzdCA
Reviews.Content: really comfortable bed, nice TV and really quiet with great security and a convenient place to park my car, the W is reight across the street and they have a wonderful spa-Bliss

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: tematalodge
Reviews.Content: Located right in Westwood, on a quiet, leafy street, the hotel was ideally situated for us. It is an easy drive to the Getty Museum and Wilshire Blvd/Santa Monica - and adjacent to UCLA. The room was small, but the bed was very soft and comfortable, double sinked bathroom, very clean. 12 noon check out was great to allow for some sightseeing before needing to leave. Friendly and helpful front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever, great location for UCLA...”
Reviews.Author: catherinemrutter
Reviews.Content: Loved it, got in really late and had to go to an 8am meeting at UCLA - gutted at getting out of the lovely lovely comfy bed :-) Breakfast a total disappointment, a heap of donuts / muffins in a cardboard box in the corner of the lobby... Wish I could have stayed longer, great hotel, love LA!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: was_a_guru
Reviews.Content: We decided on a last minute trip to LA to check out the UCLA campus, and this hotel was listed on the UCLA website. They were able to accommodate us, so we made a reservation and stayed there for two nights. The room was a reasonable size for the three of us, and although everything was a little dated, it was clean and comfortable. It offered free parking, and a somewhat minimalist but adequate free breakfast, and thus considering the cost of the other hotels in the area was a bargain. The location is ideal if you want to be near UCLA, and there many restaurants, shops, and entertainment venues within walking distance, so we basically left our car in the garage for the days we were there and walked everywhere. The staff was very cheerful and accommodating to our needs, and I would recommend this place to anyone. If my daughter decides on UCLA we will make the Hilgard House Hotel our place to stay when visiting her.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value-unfriendly front desk-grumpy owner”
Reviews.Author: mymaruska
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here probably 25 times--incredible value for a great central location. Hotel is very clean but very tired. If you expect to lounge around in a glamorous room, this is not the hotel for you. If you want a place to return to after a day of touring Los Angeles, this is the place. Rooms are very European: small and quite old furnishings but are lovingly attended to by the housekeeping staff. Coffee and tea are available in the lobby throughout the day (free) and in the morning pastries are set out as well as orange juice. My only negative would be the front desk: many of the men do not know that a smile makes a huge comment. The owner (man with a beard) is constantly present and he does not have the ability to smile or say hello. He appears to have an arrogance about him (undeserved, for sure) and he should stay in the background as his attitude is off-putting and rude. All that being said, I recommend this place and hopefully those who stay here will not run into THE GROUCH.

Reviews.Title: “Probably would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tivolo
Reviews.Content: Review of Hilgard House Hotel Itâ€™s odd, but I canâ€™t decide exactly what my opinion of this hotel is. So, I will just tell you some good features and some not-so-good featuresâ€¦ Pros: â€¢ Location, location, location â€¢ Very friendly and helpful staff â€¢ Comfortable bed â€¢ Ceiling fan â€¢ Good selection of TV channels â€¢ Reasonably quiet â€¢ Good water pressure â€¢ A/C worked fine Cons: In general, this place is just desperately in need of renovation, especially the bathroom. â€¢ There is no chain lock for the door â€¢ The shower head is at most 5 feet high so all but the shortest people have to bend over to wash their hair â€¢ Shower doors did not have any handles from the inside (there were holes where the handles used to beâ€¦) â€¢ Ice maker in fridge didnâ€™t work, and it wasnâ€™t clear that the fridge itself was even working â€¢ Very few plugs and none in convenient locations â€¢ Very small desk with no phone and no plugs â€¢ Plug next to one sink was not GCI â€¢ Closet doors were hard to open and close As far as cleanliness, itâ€™s just barely clean enough for me to be okay with it. For instance, the sheets look clean but do have some stains on them. The carpet looks really old and stained. My alarm clock had some nasty goop on the side of it. There was an ice bucket, but it was dirty and I couldnâ€™t figure out where to get ice anyway. My room had a Jacuzzi tub, but I was not the least bit tempted to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for UCLA visits!”
Reviews.Author: tennismary
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend of mine who stayed there while visiting her son at UCLA. The room was clean, somewhat stylish, and quiet. The neighborhood is within walking distance to the village of Westwood, shops, and restaurants. For the price I would say this hotel is well worth it, certainly a bargain compared to the 'W' across the street. I plan to stay there each time I visit my daughter while she is attending UCLA.

Reviews.Title: “Hilgard House still going strong”
Reviews.Author: Dot33
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have noted, the Hilgard House is a very comfortable place to stay. My room had a small patio and a good-size writing table. There was also a small fridge. The wi-fi internet was easy to use, and there is a computer in the lobby. The complimentary breakfast available in the lobby is a little limited -- bowl of fruit, bagels, donuts, juice, and coffee. But you can start in the lobby and then move on to one of the coffee shops nearby if you want more! I was somewhat surprised to discover how good the bus services to and from UCLA are. The Santa Monica "Big Blue Bus" lines, in particular, are frequent, take tourists to a good many interesting places, and cost only 75 cents per ride.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Boutique Hotel in Westwood Village”
Reviews.Author: Dolcetto
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at this charming venue from Thanksgiving Day on this year while visiting Bruin-grad son. Previously, we'd stayed at the W, just across the street, and paid far more for a room, as well as with time for the valet parking and all the rigamarole related to getting the car and getting out of the W where all kinds of activities and hullabaloo, -- while fine for an experience -- tend to interfere with the simple business of trying to blend into Westwood Village life. At Hilgard House we parked our rental in the garage every night and took the elevator up to our floor. Our delightful ultra-clean room (cleaned quickly every morning by friendly and attentive staff) faced the back of the Westwood Christian Church, a truly beautiful and historic structure visible from our large picture window. Church bells never chimed before 10, but were lovely to the ear. The lobby bowl of fruit, particularly my mandatory bananas, was alway full, with coffee available. We enjoyed a quick daily trek to the Starbucks or Coffe Bean to start the day, but it was nice to be able to grab a paper if desired in the gem of a lobby. The location and proximity to everything village-wise encouraged walking. It was fun to lunch at Whole Foods or Angelino's or just shop fabulous Westwood (including superb jeweler Michael K's), as well as wander across the street to the W for a nightcap when the mood struck. Make no mistake -- the owners of this venue are international hoteliers who have created a chic oasis that has no need of advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and dusty, great location”
Reviews.Content: We found Hilgard House through a websearch when we needed a place for the night close to UCLA. We were quite delighted with it. It has the atmosphere of a little European B&B. The decor feels like someone's mansion - pretty, in excellent taste, imperfect, maybe a bit dusty. Marble floors and granite counters in the bathrooms, tubs bigger than usual for hotels. The staff are friendly and pleasant. Breakfast is free. There's coffee in the lobby all day. There are soda and junkfood machines in the garage. Parking is free, too. Free wifi internet that was easy to access and didn't crash. There was a fridge in one room, an ice-maker in the other. We got a reasonable price - $164 with taxes. It's just off campus, near the Medical Center - walking distance. The location feels pretty safe. All the rooms are upstairs, and entrance is through a lobby which is staffed all the time. Of course there are negatives. There was dust in the tub and on the aircon, which was one of the old-fashioned type near the window. A standard lamp was broken (I think because they put in a heavy energy-saver bulb and the fixture couldn't take the extra weight). There's no desk; the bedside table doubles as one. The upholstered chair had stains on it. There was no free socket near the bed; I had to unplug the clock. All these were trivial. I would happily stay there again. It had a lot more atmosphere than the big chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “inexpensive, unpretentious charmer, UCLA adjacent”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: This small (55 rooms), unpretentious, charming inn is a good inexpensive choice if looking for simple accomodations near UCLA. The place does not try to be anything other than what it is. Apparently many people with family/friends being treated at the UCLA Medical Center stay here. The hotel's owner lives on the top floor. If you do not want or need anything other than comfortable accomodations, then this is the place for you. There is no pool, business center, fitness center, restaurant or lounge. There is, however, free parking (not for large SUV's or trucks), free continental breakfast , refrigerator in room , several premium cable channels on TV. Rooms have large bay windows with window seats. Staff is friendly. The area is safe and there are plenty of restaurants , cinemas, and shops in Westwood. Ralphs grocery store is just across the street. Also the Geffen Playhouse, where we saw the oustanding play "Rabbit Hole" during our visit. Note that the gate to the underground parking area is closed at night, so check if you plan to stay out late with your car. Across the street is the W Los Angeles Hotel. I stayed there once in years past. It is a very different place--more urban, loud, contemporary, stylish, with a see-and-be-seen pool area and lounge. More for younger folks--they had a velvet rope front entrance situation while we were there. At least $100 + a night more than Hilgard House, but it does offer more services and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “*We always stay here when visiting UCLA!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this small hotel near UCLA since our daughter attended UCLA. Contrary to a prior negative review, we have found the staff and management of Hilgard House to be EXTREMELY helpful and professional over the five plus years we have stayed at the hotel! They even managed a large family group that we had stay at the hotel during our daughter's UCLA graduation weekend. They did everything they could to make sure everyone's stay was positive and situated our large group in a convenient location. The UCLA Guesthouse is a similar type hotel on campus but we won't stay there again because of problems with extremely uncomfortable beds and shower heads set at ridiculously low height levels, and we are short people!!! Hilgard House will NOT disappoint. It is right across the street from the W Hotel. The location is safe, safe, safe!!! The hotel is quiet and pleasant! We have had every request attended to. The manager and assistant manager have been there for years and get to know their guests. Hilgard House is on the edge of the UCLA campus. The campus is in close walking distance and shopping and restaurants are also very close by. We think service in this hotel deserves five ***** stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hostility”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made reservations over the phone to stay at the hotel. When I got there I was told that the "free parking" included in the cost of the room did not pertain to my large truck (toyota tundra) and that I would have to park in the Ralph's grocery store parking lot (3-4 blocks away) at a fee of $5.00. The manager literally yelled at me in the parking garage in front of other guests. He was pointing his finger at me and shaking his finger at me. When I asked where I could stay or where the Ralph's is (being I'm not from the area I had no idea where the Ralph's was located) he became irrate and mocked and mimicked me "ohh, the poor baby, she doesn't know where to go", "poor thing", etc. After my encounter with this "man", I didn't feel safe staying there. Luckily another local hotel had a cancellation and welcomed me and my truck without any problems. The desk clerk (young gentleman) appologized profusely for the manager's behavior and stated that we would have been able to handle the situation without the manager's involvement. I have filed a complaint with The Los Angeles Area Hotel Association and I will also be contacting the Chamber of Commerce. Since so many people drive large SUV's and trucks, they should mention the parking situation when people make reservations over the phone. They could even make arrangements for a shuttle to Ralph's or a reduction in the room rate for those of us that are expected to pay to park somewhere else. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CA Gal
Reviews.Content: I decided at the last minute to drive up from San Diego and get a place near UCLA where I was picking up my daughter the next day. Even though I called only hours before my arrival, the staff was very helpful and made arrangements for me, including the exact type of room I asked for. The hotel was clean, quiet and very nice. It does not have extra facilities (pool, gym, etc.) but I did not need those - and the rate was very good for the area. The parking is secured, but the spots are a bit small. I knew this ahead of time as I had read previous reviews and my car is small so it worked for me. We didn't have much time to explore the area but it is only a block or so from UCLA in Westwood Village. I would most definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 bedroom suite for the price”
Reviews.Author: annpr
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Hilgard House for 3 months in one of the 1 bedroom suites. It is within walking distance of the UCLA Med Center. Centrally located for the hospital, it is also within walking distance of a grocery store and drug store. There are many different restaurants in the area to choose from. The staff has been very kind and considerate, leaving extra towels, etc when requested. They even left extra sheets and blankets for my son to sleep on the couch (this was a 1 bedroom). The only downside is the oven and microwave work - but are very old and should be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in Westwood near UCLA!”
Reviews.Author: Tom in Minnesota
Reviews.Content: This is a fine and reasonably priced small hotel that doesn't have a pool, work out center, business center, bar, or restaurant. It does have good, quiet rooms and a wonderful staff. There are plenty of places within a short walk to catch a bite to eat. Shopping is convenient and it is a short walk to the Hammer, a pleasant place with an impressive permanent collection. The front desk has a good collection of local maps and listings, including information about the wide array of nearby museums. The hotel also has on-site parking as well as good availability to bus and taxi services. Note that the hotel's parking spaces are rather small. I'll gladly return on my next trips West Los Angeles. Thanks to the entire staff for a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, personal and unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found that the hotel was very nice and affordable. My room was spacious with very large windows. It was also very clean. The continental breakfast every morning was also nice. The front desk was very helpful throughout our stay. It was very close to UCLA Medical Center. We would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Mousehole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Argh, what a nightmare. We booked one full year in advance to attend our son's UCLA graduation. We had to pay IN FULL to hold our room. We chose Hilgard House because of its proximity to the campus (walking distance). We were charged $175.00 per night for a closet. The bathroom was worse. We had to actually stand behind the toilet to shut the door. We found out our room was converted over from an old apartment. The "better" rooms were in the main building. Add also that their parking garage is ALWAYS full and has the narrowest spaces on the planet. It might help if the employees would not use the guest parking garage. This dump doesn't even deserve one star.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilgard House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 927 Hilgard Ave., Los Angeles, CA 90024
